result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Wayne Rogers Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May terminate early.  Four (4) days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to complete the Domestic Violence Intervention Program.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain employment.  Defendant is to have no contact with E.B., L.O., and B.B. at the discretion of the agent and with prior approval.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided.  Defendant shall comply with all restraining orders.

timeConds.notes: Stayed for violations of probation.  To be served in lock up.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
